Reviews.Title: Good budget digital
Reviews.Author: John Beowulf "beowulfborealis"
Reviews.Content: I was tired of hauling around a D200 Nikon.  I get great results from it, but it can't shoot video or fit in my pocket.I picked up one of these Kodak jobs and was pleased.  It had a really good macro, shoots nice video, and has all the stuff I need except for an SD card.  You will have to buy one since the camera has limited memory.  But it can take up to a 32 gig card.  Amazing.  The battery seems to have lots of juice too, which is always a problem for small compact cameras.  The colors from the software are good.  I hate having to photoshop images, and this has a nice color balance.  Good flash too.

Reviews.Title: Love it !!!
Reviews.Author: SteveNguyen
Reviews.Content: Before buying point and shoot camera , i did lot of researches and finally end up buying this one.What i was looking for was something at reasonable price and not too fancy. I have seen many negative comments about this Kodak M-341 until i own it. The picture quality is awesome and more than i expected it to be.With the price 110, you cant go wrong with this one ..Many people complain this camera making "clicking sound"; however, you can make it stop making that sound by turn "continuous" mode to "single mode"..that function is Auto focus , therefore, the lens automatically adjusts to get the best quality pics (Smart Capture)

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: Onsted
Reviews.Content: The camera is compact, which was an attribute my wife wanted. It is easy to use and takes great pictures. Takes great video also. So far we haven't found anything we don't like about it.

Reviews.Title: Self destructs on day 32
Reviews.Author: J. Mallonee
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter who is taking a photography class in school.  For the first month, it was an awesome camera. The pictures were great the features were fun and easy to work with.  But suddenly, for no apparent reason, the focus was off for the wide angle zoom. I reset the camera like the book suggested, and still had the same problem. This was purchased through Amazon, so I thought I might send it back. Their return date was 2 days prior.  I contacted Kodak, and they could fix the issue, for about $130 plus shipping both ways. This for a camera I paid less than $100 for.  I would not recommend this camera for anyone. I am disappointed in not only the product but in the way all of the companies involved handled the situation.

Reviews.Title: You can teach an old dog new tricks
Reviews.Author: Gayle D. Sharp
Reviews.Content: I am new to the digital camera (drag me into the 21st century) and when my great grandson was born I needed to take pictures of my own and not rely on anyone else. I received this camera and was up and taking pictures within hours (had to charge battery).  I now am an old pro, this camera is so easy to use and the pictures come out perfect everytime.  I would recommend this camera to all age groups who need a basic camera.  I even learned how to load the pics onto my computer and onto facebook.  Kodak, you are number 1 in my book!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Crystal Brown
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! The picture quality is amazing, up close photos turn out crisp and clear. Smart Capture setting auto adjusts photo lighting, exposure etc. to give you the most clear photos for your surroundings automatically! This camera is super easy to use even the manual is easy to use, 5-7 pages of everything you need to know about this camera with troubleshooting pages/tips at the end. An in camera HELP button also makes using this camera easy! The camera has the LI ION battery which makes the camera A LOT lighter, you really notice how bulky and heavy a double AA battery camera is once you start using this one, not only does it relieve the weight but not having to change batteries every so often while shooting pics at an event or parade and missing that one great shot is awesome. The battery that came with it has yet to die on me yet but I am going to go ahead and buy another just in case, just found one only $13 brand new! I used to be against Kodak cameras but this M341 has changed my mind!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Kier "Ken"
Reviews.Content: The camera works great. With the 12 mega-pixels the pictures are sharp and clear. Adding a memory card greatly increases storage capabilities. Charging the camera directly from the USB port enables the user to utilize any generic USB charger, this is great for on-the-go vehicle charging. I recommend purchasing a case for the camera, one is not included.

Reviews.Title: Incredible!
Reviews.Author: Cynthia C. Tochkin "C Moven S"
Reviews.Content: It has awesome quality pictures and it's sleek and stylish! Plus on Amazon.com the price is very good compared to the actual Kodak website! Ships super fast to. It is very easy to use and with 12.2 MP to just go wild with, you can take some really killer pictures with it! The only thing I find wierd is that it doesn't come with a memory card... You have to buy one separately like I did (I just found it out when I got the camera about a week ago) :(  The camera has an internal memory card built in, but it doesn't really hold a lot... (Only 10 pictures and 29 seconds of video.) Pretty much just a sample of what it can do. If you want to buy this camera, (and I recommend you do because it's Kodak) then do remember to buy a memory card while you buy the camera because then you don't have to make the mistake that I did and wait for another week or 2 to get it, Just warning you  :)PS. This is what memory card i'm buying for my camera:[...]They also come in 4, 16 and 32GB to I think...Anyway, hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the cost!
Reviews.Author: K. Noto
Reviews.Content: It may not have the functionality of my big ol' DSLR but it takes beautiful point-and-shoot photos. Pretty tough (I dropped it a few times). Took it to Hawaii for the amazing panorama feature.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: John D. Delaney "olecowboy68"
Reviews.Content: We received this Camera very fast.  It was easy to use and made great pictures. The 12.1 MP really makes a difference in quality.

Reviews.Title: Photographer who bought a second one... really love it!
Reviews.Author: Moss
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in the spring of 2010 to take on a long hike on the Pacific Crest trail. I am a professional photographer, so i am used to having a huge camera and lenses all the time, but for the trip i needed a compact lightweight point and shoot. The photos i took with it turned out amazing! They are sharp, detailed, and the color pops nicely with little to no post manipulation. The battery lasts for quite a long time. The menus and controls take some getting accustomed to, but once you figure it out, it's simple. It only weighs 4.1oz, so it was the best choice for a backpacking trip. Although it may not be recommended, i used my ipod charger wall-plug-in-thingy to charge it, so i only needed the camera's supplied usb cable in my backpack with the ipod stuff (which is also a cool feature - you can charge it with a computer's usb powered bus). The first one that i got was not from amazon, and i got a free extra battery with the camera (but at the time it cost more), but i don't think i ever had to switch. The panorama stitching in the camera is very smart, but hard to line up sometimes (in the bright california desert). I must also say that recently i got a fish tank, and i've been trying to take pictures of them with no good luck, but i can't get them to hold still enough for my D80 either, but at least i can get a focus... the kodak has trouble focusing on the correct fish in the tank and there is no way to manually control it. Another note - probably the video on this camera is not so great, but at least it does not eat up a lot of card space, and it would end up on youtube anyways! I gave the silver hiking trip camera to my girlfriend for her birthday and bought a second one of these in black just to make sure i got another one before they discontinue the model. She has fun with hers taking photos of her cat and pretty sunsets and her friends. This review is mostly on outdoor photos, i barely used the flash, so i am not sure if there are bad red-eye problems or harsh flash issues, but it's $89, and you get more than you pay for. This is my favorite camera for the price. here are some photos that i took with it in california: […]

Reviews.Title: Excellent Photo Quality... but no HD Video
Reviews.Author: K. Christensen "Average Dad"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace a Kodak v1233 it was a great camera for a great price and this has been too. The only thing we liked about our v1233 was that it took great HD video... this doesn't do HD but on the bright side the lower quality video doesn't take up as much space (not that that is really a bright side). We always give out custom family calendars to our parents as Christmas gifts and the low quality images from cameras of our brothers and sisters always seem to "ruin" our good calendar picture sets. This camera has never failed us and works seamlessly with both our Mac and PC. Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Sunshine Lover
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say that I rarely ever feel that a product is so poor that I need to post a negative review. I almost always leave positive feedback for any products we use and are happy with. However, I do feel it's important for others to be aware of possible issues.After having great success with a Kodak Easyshare camera in the past, when my son put a camera on his wish list for Christmas 2009, we decided to go with this camera. Less than 10 months later in September 2010, it suddenly stopped working completely. We were shocked since we had positive experience with Kodak in the past. Still under warranty, we shipped it in for repair. Then, we were told that the camera had rust AND corrosion on the inside and the warranty was voided. So, in order to have the repair completed we'd have to pay $79.95 in addition to the $8 shipping it to them we'd already paid. Since we've had the camera, it has NEVER come into contact with any liquid whatsoever. Even if it had, there is no way it would have rusted and corroded to this extent since we've had it. After several emails, and a phone call (25 minutes on hold) to Customer Service, I was told that there was no option. We'd have to pay for the repair. We have decided to cut our losses and just purchase a new camera. This time we're going with a Sony for our son since we have several other Sony products including two digital cameras and they always stand behind their products.

Reviews.Title: cheap, and it kinda shows...
Reviews.Author: John Beowulf "beowulfborealis"
Reviews.Content: I bought this thing and headed to the tropics for a while.  It was easy to use and had all the features I wanted.Got home and was somewhat disappointed with the picture quality.  There is no UV filter in the camera, so mid day photos are pretty hazy.  I expected a lot out of this camera, and got most of what I wanted, but I have seen better in the pocket digital camera world.  I don't know where they get the idea of 12.2 MP on this chip.  Yes, the files are big, but still grainy, I would guess from a less than great lens.  Why bother with a big sensor if you won't install a decent lens?

Reviews.Title: For a basic camera it's good
Reviews.Author: Amanda P. Minaker "poetsoul"
Reviews.Content: I have a wide variety of experience with cameras so my review is skewed a bit. That said, this camera is a nice, basic camera with decent picture quality. I haven't printed any photos yet- I do mainly online sharing of kid photos with this camera. My only complaint is that already the camera has had to be adjusted. At one point, for no discernable reason the camera would not focus- and there was plenty of light. I went into the camera menu and it was easy to return to factory settings. Now it is fine. Slow to focus but otherwise, a good camera for reasonable price. The shipping was fast.

Reviews.Title: Average photo quality but auto focus has issues
Reviews.Author: M. Kaufman
Reviews.Content: I recently purchases this camera after my old Canon A95 died.  The picture quality is better than I expected.  It starts up quick and has a decent lag time between shots.  Given the $100 price tag, I really shouldn't have any complaints.  Regardless, the 'clicking noises' caused by the camera's auto focus constantly adjusting the position of the stepper motor that drives the lens is annoying.  Annoying to the point that I wish I'd spent twice as much on different camera that had similar photo quality.  One of my friends has a Canon A1100 that has similar performance but is quiet as a mouse.  With the number of micro steps the auto focus directs the stepper motor to take, I'd be surprised if this camera lasts more than two years.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Amy M. Ferrell "Amalama"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera because I have another Kodak Easyshare at work and found it to have a long internal battery life and to be lightweight while taking excellent pictures.  Since that was what I was looking for at home I knew Easyshare would be my choice.  This model is even more intuitive than the one I have at work, like recognizing that when I've inserted a memory card that I want the camera to use it, rather than having to program it that way.  This, of course, is necessary as the internal memory is incredibly limited.  The battery life if amazing.  I love that the internal battery makes it really lightweight and it lasts for a long, long time.  I've taken oodles of pics and about 5 different 2-3 minute videos and I still have about 70% of the battery available. The picture quality is great- it snaps quickly and action shots turn out awesome.  It has performed well in different types of light, including bright sunlight and darkened rooms.  I am not a serious photographer by any means, but it does everything I need it to do and more.  I am also happy with the video quality.In short, I love this easy to use camera and feel like it is a great quality camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M341 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: David Spangler "smilin_dave"
Reviews.Content: First bought this camera to replace my wife's stolen camera. Liked it a lot and purchased another to replace my Nikon Coolpix 4300 which cost nearly 4 times as much.For us, the criteria were that the camera was inexpensive, had a rechargeable battery with charger, uses SD memory cards and very quick first and subsequent shots. The large LCD viewing screen is nice and the controls are pretty intuitive. Photo quality is excellent.I'm not a huge fan of the Easy Share software because it tends to take control of the process of importing the images to the PC. However, it is very functional and Kodak seems more marketing-oriented than some other brands.Bottom line: very good value for under $100. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Easy Share M341
Reviews.Author: Mary Jean Collender-Merando
Reviews.Content: I am still learning my camera but I really love it right now. One thing I wish is that it came with a better mannual but the camera is easy to manuever through.  I have tried various settings and for the most part the pictures have come out beautiful.  The ones that didn't were very easy to delete.  The camera is light and easy to take with you any place so it is very portable.  One other thing I wish it has was the ability to be used with my older Easy Share printer port.  But as a whole I am very pleased with the purchase.  The camera works well and the company I purchased it from was totally awesome.  They got the package out in days.  I didn't have to wait long for the camera to show up and I was using it in no time.

Reviews.Title: Very good budget camara
Reviews.Author: Paulo E. Ríos "Paulo.-"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camara in a honey-I-forgot-the-camara situation just before boarding an eirplane.I am fascinating with it. nice size, even slim enough to fit in a shirt pocket. the panoramic feature is really good.batteries last me two entire days with normal (30) photo shooting and  5 minutes videos.Only one thing: the mode dial easy moves to video setting, when putting it in your pocket or in a case.my two cents.-

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Lisa L. Swineheart
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my camara so far. This is the first digital Camaera I have owned or even operated! So I was a digital camara virgin so to speak. It was very easy for me to learn to operate --the instructions are very clear and easy to understand. I just had to play around with it a bit and was taking pictures and reviewing them right away. I love the picture quality but I have gone from the throw aways from the grocery store to this 12.2mp! I had a bit of trouble getting the pictures on my computer and needed a little outside help from my son--but again this is my first one. The feature I love about this Kodak easyshore camara is being able to upload the pictures to my facebook so easily! Also it is just the right size to put in my purse and carry with me everywhere so I can have it on hand. I just have to make sure it has a good charge before I go! It does seem to be holding its charge pretty good! I think this camara is a good digital camara for a first timer like me. I so look forward to all the pictures this camara and I will be taking together and all the memories I will be able to save and share.

Reviews.Title: Like this camera, but....
Reviews.Author: D. Schreckengost "DMS"
Reviews.Content: The camera is all that it is advertised to be.  However, there is one feature I am disappointed in.  The camera will not automatically date stamp the photos as they are taken.  In order to date stamp photos, they have to be stamped manually, one at a time.  Very disappointed about this since most of my photos are date stamped.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot product
Reviews.Author: clm "spinner"
Reviews.Content: Wonderful product for taking along without the bulk of some higher end cameras.  For the average user this product can do the job with pictures.  Quality of pictures is quite stunning.  The audio portion of the video seems distorted, but I did not buy the camera for this purpose, so I am still pleased overall.

Reviews.Title: Simple to use
Reviews.Author: Jorge S
Reviews.Content: This camera has real good picture quality and it's easy to use. I used it for night picutures and it really worked pretty well. The panoramic feature is cool too. Overall, real good camera for the money. The bad when you go to look at your pictures the lense stays out. The good the rechargable wall outlet battery. The smart capture feture, which automatically adjusts to the setting around you is awesome.

Reviews.Title: slick little camera
Reviews.Author: malchik6655321
Reviews.Content: If you want quality pics (12.2 MP) without paying out a lot for it, this camera could be for you. The stop-blur feature is especially nice since I had some problems with this and my old camera. The camera is very compact and charges, which is another important feature for me, because who likes rotating batteries? Overall works well and pretty easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Tammy L. Frymire "tamzill2"
Reviews.Content: Bought the M341 last night, was shooting pictures right out of the box.  I got a great deal at Office Depot that included the camera, xtra battery and case for $99.00 of course you definately need an additional memory card. Uploaded the pics without having to install any software.  I love that you can charge the camera  without removing the battery. I also love that the USB u plug into the computer is the same cord u use to charge the battery. The less stuff to keep up with the better.  I bought an 8GB Memory Disk that is suppose to hold 4000 pics. I still have a lot to learn about it but it appears to be very simple.  I also bought the Kodak 6150 direct from Kodak last week.  Love, love, love it. I went with the 6150 because I needed the fax and I love an ADF as well as a duplexer.I had a problem with software loading (my computer, not the printers fault), I called Kodak we did a few key strokes in the back door and was up and running in an hour. Again, love, love, love it. I also love the fact that Kodak makes a user friendly product that you can use without a computer, my step-daughter got 1 for Christmas and she just loves how easy it is to use and inexpensive to take all those pics of her new baby.I also love Amazon and was going to purchase thru Amazon but my husband wanted to get it and have plenty of time to practice with it b/4 our trip next weekend to see the grandbabies. I did make my purchase based on the Amazon reviews.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!  Grea price!
Reviews.Author: B. Byler "BB"
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera, I bought it as a gift but I own one myself.  Picture quality and features are awesome...  Can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: Not the Greatest
Reviews.Author: sara b
Reviews.Content: I had a Samsung BL103 for awhile and it was my first digital camera.  I loved it!  But when the autofocus died, I figured I'd just get a new camera than pay well over the original price to get it fixed.  I found this camera and thought it was great!  At first.  The noise of the camera focusing is very annoying.  I read that they all do this, so I just thought I would get used to it.  Wrong.  After a month and a half of daily use, it drives me nuts!  But still it seemed like a good camera so I could overlook the noise if the pictures and video were good.  The pictures were ok.  I have better shots I took with a disposable camera, but then again I did not really mess with the settings all that much.  For most of my pictures I just want to take the picture, not have to go into the menu and change a bunch of stuff.  My biggest complaint would have to be the video.  At normal zoom, it was ok.  But as soon as you zoom in at all it is so pixelated that you can barely tell what you are recording!  I was not all the way zoomed, just a little bit, not sure of the exact number.  I do have to say that the sound was good.  My old camera would cut out as you are zooming, but this one was still recording sound.  I think I am just going to fork out the money and get a canon...

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Ambrose
Reviews.Content: I did a ton of research before buying a digital camera and this one is great!  The only thing that they don't tell you when you buy it is that you need to buy a video card with it but I still got to use it anyway while waiting to receive the video card because it has internal memory so I could at least try it out.  This camera takes great pictures and has the great feature to hold still for us shaking photogs.  This is the first digital camera that I have owned and I am so satisfied with this purchase.  So satisfied in fact that my husband bought one for himself.  I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: GREAT WONDERFUL AWESOME....UNTIL...
Reviews.Author: danah redmond
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, takes GORGEOUS CLEAR PERFECT PICTURES! NO BLUR! FUN PANORAMA, SUPER NICE PRODUCT!The only problem is that THIS camera has an issue. It AT RANDOM has a motor issue that DOES NOT allow it to turn on! It turns on then IMMEDIATELY off. On....IMMEDIATELY off....I would get another camera still a Kodak, I will probably ALWAYS buy Kodak, but this particular model is not the best one. Battery life is INCREDIBLE, indoors, outdoors, wonderful!! FIts easily in a pocket or small carry case, perfect for all types of settings and just a great camera....however, the second it quits working is the second I quit liking it as much....3 stars.Janediaryofaregularmom at BLOGSPOT

Reviews.Title: Kodak review
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W. Franklin
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price. Good quality pictures, however, it doesn't take clear pictures in low light with zoom option. Overall, good camera!

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Harping Dude "Art"
Reviews.Content: For years I swore by Kodak. My wife dropped her old Kodak and it didn't work no more.  I bought her the M341 because it will take instant pictures. Ever aim, shoot and find out the subject had moved out of the picture? Just try to take pictures of a graduation ceremony. This camera has a dial with a picture of a running man on it. Put the dial on the running man and take moving or sports pictures.It works like a film camera and takes a picture time you press the button. The first M341 just stopped working at about 4 months old. I figured we had done something wrong. I ordered this one and it lasted 3 months. They just stop working. Again, it takes beautiful pictures( both sports and extreme closeups) but you can't rely on it to be there when you need it. This camera is not for sale on the Kodak website anymore. I think they figured out they had a problem too.

Reviews.Title: Short life
Reviews.Author: outoftown
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift a little more than a year ago. It just stopped working for no reason. I haven't dropped it and it has received no damage, it just stopped working. This is by far the shortest life of a digital camera I have ever had. I was incredibly disappointed in this and am never purchasing a Kodak camera again.

Reviews.Title: Buggy to say the least
Reviews.Author: Caitlin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this model for my mom last Black Friday (2009) for Christmas. When first opened we charged the camera fully and tried it out. It would turn on for a second (literally) then turn back off. We tried plugging the ac adapter in to the usb and still the same problem. I fiddled around with the batteries off and on for about a week and finally got it to work after trying various things. A few months later the same problem started happening again. Now I googled the problem online and it seems a bunch of people have the same issue and I will need a part replaced. Horrible construction on this model and I will not be buying another Kodak after.

Reviews.Title: Didn't like the camera at all, bad quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I'm disappointed with my new Kodak EasyShare M341 camera. Night pictures are so bad and gray, and day time pictures miss some contrast.The flash is weak and also doesn't seem like 12.2 MP at all. My 7.2 Sony camera's picture is much better.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare M341 Digital Camera that makes me a pro picture taker!
Reviews.Author: elaine sylvester
Reviews.Content: This camera is really easy to use. It takes wonderful quality pictures. It is small enough to fit in my pocket. It has panoramic capability. I would recommend this Kodak EasyShare M341 digital camera to anyone who wants to have an easy to operate digital camera that takes good quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: camera review-purchased Amazon.com
Reviews.Author: H. Stiarwalt "Happy Customer"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Was recommended by a friend and she was so right. Easy, takes great pictures and has all the functions you want in a camera and paid $100 less than camera before that I lost and pictures are just as good and functions on this one much easier.

Reviews.Title: Great and still getting to know it.
Reviews.Author: Yoyo
Reviews.Content: Before buying this item, I looked up reviews and saw that it was around average 8.7/8.8-9. That was enough for me. It has a lot of features. It does make a clicking noise haha it's not broken. But I like the camera a lot compared to my old Kodak camera that had 3 features although the macro was awesome. I really like this camera, I would suggest it's for someone who wants it for leisure purposes than professional use. There's a panorama option too which I haven't learned how to use and I'm one of the type of people who are too lazy to read the manual so I'm figuring it out slowly. Also to power the camera it comes with a usb inserter (2 in 1), so it's great, you get your usb for the computer and your charger :) It's easy to use. And the screen is very large, even people I know who are elderly can see everything on this screen so woot! :) I think it's a pretty good camera. I didn't give it full stars only because I'm still getting to know it and I haven't found something that really makes me go: OMGGG no other camera has this option! THIS IS AWESOME. lol. But it's a good camera. I'd keep it in a case or something after you buy because I think it could break the screen. So that's my little suggestion. :)

Reviews.Title: Don't Waste Your Money!
Reviews.Author: April Watkins-bravo "Super Mommi"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a waste of money! Everyday pictures are grainy and blurry in general unless the object is absolutely still and even then the pictures are extremely sensitive to light which creates often pictures that are far too dark.  Maybe if I didn't own two cameras I wouldn't realize how terrible this one is but my Canon takes really good photos compared to this one.  I really wish I could return this piece of junk but my company bought it for work photos and all I can say it is a full time job trying to get a photo that will work. I can't believe this camera has even one good review...shocking!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Diane Surman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use for general picture taking. It seems to work well and is easy to use.  I've had no problems with it and have been very satisfied. I like the fact that it is small and lightweight. The color is pretty too.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Erin Duchon
Reviews.Content: For a relatively cheap camera, I love this! It takes AMAZING pictures- especially when you print them out. I couldn't have asked for a better camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Pleased as could be!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Shelton "Warhammer seller"
Reviews.Content: This camera was more then afordable and the 12.2 megapixels with the small objects features is great for taking pictures of small items for ebay options. I also love the panaramic view ability took some beutiful pictures with it already and I hope to take many more.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: K. Ford
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my wife and she loves it. its easy to use and as great picture quality. i would definitely recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M341
Reviews.Author: J. Jones
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased as a gift after researching similar products.  The recipient was truly surprised and pleased, and the reports have all been very favorable.  Looks, durability, features, picture quality, and size all played a part.  We're happy to have made this purchase.

Reviews.Title: had the exact camera but lost it
Reviews.Author: Dr. Stephen J. Safran
Reviews.Content: just what I wanted and very pleased. Works like new. always pleased with things from amazon. so glad you had a duplicate

Reviews.Title: Very fun, simple and excellent
Reviews.Author: Edwin Polanco
Reviews.Content: Xtreme quality, excellent shots, awesome pictures opcions, in al ways is a very good and economic piece, you never be diswise with this camera...

Reviews.Title: Ready to click again!
Reviews.Author: Mary Steen
Reviews.Content: I purchased this one because I loved my first one!!  Easy for me to operate and at a reasonable price.  Love the color!!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, good quality
Reviews.Author: MarvelousMe
Reviews.Content: I love my Kodak Easyshare M341 Digital Camera in the color Orchid--the color is gorgeous, the photos are crisp and clear, the settings are easy (and there are a lot of different options) and is small enough to fit in my pocket and take anywhere. What's not to love?The design is very nice, and the settings are incredibly easy to use, and the photos look surprisingly professional for a digital camera under $200.The memory card and battery are stored underneath in a slot that is covered by the same pink-ish material that the rest of the camera is made of, so you slide it and underneath is your memory card and battery, with no danger of falling out (it can happen, other cameras aren't as secure).The settings range from snowy day, to beach, to night, or even self-portrait. You can turn flash on and off, you can take video (and zoom in while taking the video), and viewing photos is simple--you can even adjust the volume while watching videos (some cameras don't).This is a nice camera for the photographer on the go, or a first camera for a tween/teenager.

Reviews.Title: It's a great camera
Reviews.Author: Felicia
Reviews.Content: I love my camera. It has worked so well for me that I have officially given it a name! (I name all of my loyal subjects lol). The picture quality is great, the feel is heavy enough to know it's sturdy but light enough to not feel bulky. Also, it fits in my pocket...well, my back pocket at least. I usually end up having five pictures of myself out of the hundreds I take because my camera is better than theirs lol. The thing that I noticed is that the only way to upload is to have a sdcard capable of wifi and of course internet connection. So, it's not exactly easy Easyshare lol.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: S. Swygert
Reviews.Content: I had an older model (M753) for several years that I loved.  This model has all the same features with better resolution.  Great for taking a lot of photos on a tripod with the easy timer features.

Reviews.Title: broke like all the others
Reviews.Author: Mailliw Sugna
Reviews.Content: I have bad luck with digital cameras. This one broke under warranty just before Kodak went under. Lucky me I got another crappy digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Going 2 years strong!!!!
Reviews.Author: mclucasdm
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, as of a month ago, I've had the camera for two years! I don't know why there are so many bad reviews, maybe those people are just very irresponsible.  I am a 21 year old college student, who just keeps my camera in my purse (with no case) and this camera has yet to crash on me.  It takes great pictures! I get so many compliments on the quality of my Facebook photos, everyone always assumes I have some professional Nikon camera, especially because I love to take pictures; but, nope, I own this Kodak Easyshare M341 in pink!!!

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Kayla
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after doing very little research that I wish I would have done. The camera worked great for about a year and then all of the sudden the camera quit working. I went to use it and took one picture and the camera just shut off. It wouldn't turn back on and I tried to recharge it but nothing. Of course the warranty was up a few days prior to this happening. This seems to be a common occurrence. I would steer clear from even thinking about purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: Decent compact camera
Reviews.Author: Stevo F
Reviews.Content: I've had two other Kodak Easyshare cameras and bought this one to take better video clips and because it is slim and I can slip it in my pocket to take to my son's soccer games. The camera doesn't fail me there, as the video is less choppy than my old 6 MP Kodak. Hoever, I find the overall picture quality to not be as good. Lots of blurry shots (even on the anti-blur setting) and even for some still shots, compared ot my previous camera. It's alos not as good with low light shots. It's been working fine for almost 2 years now (none of the early failure issues mentioned by other reviewers), but I would like a camera with more consistantly sharp photos.

Reviews.Title: Good camera until it erased my pictures
Reviews.Author: Lynna S. Nix
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at a great sale and was fairly pleased with it straight out of the box. This was my second EasyShare, so navigating the menu was simple. It took nice shots in brightly-lit situations, but indoor shots at my daughters' basketball games were always dark and grainy. The battery life was good for a pocket camera, but the 3x optical zoom left a lot to be desired. It is noisy and makes a lot of whirring and clicking when it tries to autofocus, but I've since read there's way to stop that.A week ago I was working on transferring pictures (via the USB cable connection)from my SD card to my hard drive when my daughter did something that required me to grab the camera to take a few pictures. I took two pictures and turned the camera off. A couple of minutes later I wanted to take another picture, so I turned the camera on again. The light flashed on for a second, and the lens extended, but the screen remained blank. No amount of button-pushing would get the screen to come back up. After about a minute the lens retracted. I tried starting the camera again to the same results.Getting worried at this point, I plugged the camera back into my computer, but it wouldn't communicate with my computer. The computer didn't even show that there was a device connected. Then came the true kiss of death for the M341. I pulled out the SD card and popped it into the slot on the front of my computer. Rather than trying to bring up the pictures, my computer will only try to format the disk, which means that the camera erased those pictures and the SD card is blank. I lost several irreplaceable images on there, such as my youngest daughter's first day of kindergarten. I lost probably 6 months worth of pictures.This was not a case of operator error. I looked at the number of pictures available when I turned on the camera the first time, and the card was about half full, so they were still there at the time it started malfunctioning.I've since messed around with it a little more and found that the camera will work without an SD card, which is very impractical since you can only get 10 pictures at its highest setting. Still, I may let my daughter play with it.I've now purchased a Sony Cybershot DSC-H55 and am very pleased with what I've seen so far.

Reviews.Title: Good camera-- minus the sand
Reviews.Author: Kittia "Kittia"
Reviews.Content: My dad got me this camera on clearance last summer after my older kodak started not being reliable (after 3 years of good use).I had this camera for a few months and then took it to the beach at the beginning of the school year.. I did not drop it or get sand in it (that I know of), or anything detrimental, but it quit working by the time I got home. I thought it was just the battery, so I charged it and it still didn't work-- I would power it on and the lens would start to come out but it got stuck and went back in.Fortunately, I got a hold of kodak and sent it in and they repaired it and I got many more months of use from it. Unfortunately, the same exact thing happened to it exactly a year later. I took it to the beach (and didn't even take it out of my purse this time), and it was not working by the time I got home. Same issues. Time to replace it for good.Needless to say, it was a great camera when it worked. I was hoping to upgrade to a dslr, but at this point I'll have to stick with another point-and-shoot which will probably end up being another Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera
Reviews.Author: adrianasarai
Reviews.Content: I am 15 years old, and I bought this camera for Christmas last year. At first this camera was great, and towards June the buttons stopped working, I don't know how this happened. I didn't drop it, so I don't know what happened.

Reviews.Title: Video Quality is the worst I've ever Used!!
Reviews.Author: KHam0214
Reviews.Content: This camera is absolutely horrible! I purchased it hoping that I could start making tutorials on YouTube because I get alot of requests for my polymer clay jewelry, and the video quality is LITERALLY THE WORST I'VE EVER USED!!! The focus and sound quality are absolutely awful!! I paid over $120 for this camera and I honestly would have rather stuck with my $29 Logitech web cam! Kodak's hate me for some reason .... will never buy another one!! :(

Reviews.Title: The video's AUDIO died after one year-the warranty expired 2 weeks ago.
Reviews.Author: David "David"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UC', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } swfParams.xmlUrl = "http://www.amazon.com/gp/mpd/getplaylist-v2/" + movieID + "/000-0000000-0000000"; flashParams.wmode = "transparent"; swfParams.autoPlay = "1"; } if (document.getElementById('cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCduration')) { document.getElementById('cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCduration').style.display='none'; } cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCloadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91RrJh-WoJS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCpreplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCpreplayImageId'); if (cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCpreplay) { cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCpreplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91RrJh-WoJS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91RrJh-WoJS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCcurrentClick) { return cv_mo3VWD3XCTEA6UCcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:52 MinsI've had this camera for a year now, and just as the warranty's expired about 2 weeks ago, the audio in any videos that I take is not there anymore.Kodak said that there's a hardware error in the camera....All in all.....the still photos were great, but, for a video camera....there were other issues. Didn't take good videos in bright light....zoom was pretty poopy.......not a great video camera....this is a better STILL camera. It has a 'Smart Capture' which is a type of automatic picture taking which guesses pretty good at making a good picture for you.But, I'm not going Kodak EasyShare anymore...

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Mark Leider
Reviews.Content: I've only shot about a dozen Lake Michigan fishing images with this camera so far, but I am more than satisfied. The price was surprisingly low, and the photos are sharp, crisp, and with great color. My wife has an older Kodak EasyShare and her 100s of photos from Europe, Alaska, Washington, D.C., and at home would compare well with any others. Finally, it's very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Mom Loves It !
Reviews.Author: S. Helms "Hard working 50 year old"
Reviews.Content: Don't know how we managed without Image Stabilization before ! Present for Mom for Mother's Day this year.She Loves it ! Older model, but made sure I got her 1 similar to her last Kodak M Series she had for over 5 years only better !

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: The original camera, to be delivered by USPS, didn't arrive.  I got in touch with Amazon and they had a second one shipped overnight at their expense.  The camera is a replacement for an identical one (other than color) I bought in March 2010 that broke in April 2011 (the autofocus quit working).  I decided to get another Kodak because the price was so good ($70 for a black one), and because I now have an extra battery and charger.

Reviews.Title: Just what our 13 year old daughter needed for her class trip
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Tashner
Reviews.Content: This camera is just what our daughter needed for her class trip.  My favorite part of the camera is the ability to use a charger instead of a bunch of batteries.  Syncs well with my mac, as compared to the last Kodak easy share camera we purchased.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: isoinfo
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera. My 3 daughters and I all have this camera and are very happy with picture quality and allthe special features. Though it's pocket sized and compact in design, it is quite versatile in capability.Good audio and video on filming and great corrective measures for even the least experienced photographer.

Reviews.Title: Not happy
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Munyan
Reviews.Content: Stopped working after a few months for no reason. I took a picture then five minutes later went to take another and it was dead.  It was not constructed well. The screen looks scrachy and dirty that makes it hard to see your pictures.. Not happy at all with this camera. It was 50/50 if you got a blurry picture or not.

Reviews.Title: Great Cameral
Reviews.Author: Jeraco
Reviews.Content: I needed a smaller camera.  I was very suprised on the size, quality and ease of this Kodak.  Anyone that needs a small point and shoot, this is it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Frequent Shopper
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a simple point and shoot that took good pictures.  I totally found it with the Kodak EasyShare M341.  The pictures that it takes look like they came from a professional grade camera.  A little of the paint coating did peel off the front, but the camera works extremely well.  This was a wise investment.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the money
Reviews.Author: DocHugo
Reviews.Content: La camara es facil de utilizar, robusta, compacta, tiene guias en pantalla muy comprensibles, buena variedad de usos y las fotos son de buena calidad. Pierde un poco de puntaje en condiciones de poca luz.Easy to use camera, strong, compact, with guide on screen very easy to understand, a nice variety of shooting styles and pictures of good quality, It looses a bit stars in low light situations

Reviews.Title: Camera only lasted a few months
Reviews.Author: kat
Reviews.Content: I received an easy share camera through Amazon for my birthday in June. It worked for my vacation in June. After that the flash stopped working. I have tried to contact kodak several times and no one responsed. It would cost me as much as a new camera to get the flash repaired.

Reviews.Title: Didn't love the camera
Reviews.Author: MaggieR
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about the past 6 months. It does take good pictures for daytime. For an amateur photographer, it is rather easy to use as well. My problems started when I took my camera to my graduation ceremony. The pictures that were taken at dusk came out terrible- very dark and the ones that were taken inside of the cathedral were too dark as well. If you take a picture where there is any type of reflection, the flash will go off and will reflect in the picture. My cousin took photos with a Cannon point and shoot camera and her photos came out fine. I am replacing this Kodak camera for the Cannon SD. I don't want to risk losing any more photo opportunities with the Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Good but defective
Reviews.Author: Gabriel K. Essel
Reviews.Content: I bought the product and the lens stopped retracting after 4 days. Unfortunately i had it sent to Ghana so i could not apply for warranty. Luckily I have been able to fix it.It was due a faulty gear system in the lens.

Reviews.Title: fast shiping
Reviews.Author: Jose
Reviews.Content: it is a good camera, very light weigth and pretty, they shiped it really fast

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Dotterjudy
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use.  The video taking is easy, so is the picture.  It charges quickly and gets the job done.  One thing that has frustrated me is the options to adjust photos.  To make the pics black and white, it seems to take a few steps that I can't seem to figure out.  I should probably read the manual, but with other cameras I've had, it's been a lot easier.  However, Kodak is a great brand and they continue their good efforts with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Ok basic camera
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Powell
Reviews.Content: Expecting a basic camera and that is what this camera is; very basic. Picture quality is just average and view screen is just average, and below average in sun light. I bought it for work thinking of a low price camera and.....you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: not happy.
Reviews.Author: Paula Aquino "gift lover"
Reviews.Content: this works great,stays charged,but getting pictures on the internet is a problem,so i bought a different one.

Reviews.Title: excellent for the price
Reviews.Author: Liliana B
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent for the price, the shoot to take the picture is fast, images has good quality and none of my pictures were blurred.The menu is easy to share and its size is perfect because its fit in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Mary E. Sicard
Reviews.Content: I haven't used the camera very much but very pleased with every aspect at this time.

Reviews.Title: Nice but noisy
Reviews.Author: victory
Reviews.Content: I like this camera, but it has a annoying clicking noise when you take pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera choice
Reviews.Author: Brenda K. Grogg
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera from Amazon. Takes very clear pictures and easy to operate.  Was completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Kodak easyshare M341
Reviews.Author: James Hogsett
Reviews.Content: I've had the pink version of this camera for about a year.  It took good pictures up until 3 days ago.  It all started when the lens refused to open a couple weeks ago.  I fixed that by using a trick I found online but when I tried to zoom the lens would immediately close.  I figured I'd deal with this until I could get it fixed or get an upgrade camera that I've was planning on getting anyway.  3 days ago I was taking pictures of my new puppy and my other dogs.  I took about 6 pictures and all of the sudden the camera wouldn't focus anymore.  All of the pictures are now extremely blurry.  I reset the camera but it doesn't help.  I compared those 6 pictures to others I took previously and they are a little off.  I'm hoping I'll be able to get those pictures off of the camera.  I see from other reviews that it is more expensive to get the camera fixed then to buy a new one and the closest camera repair shop is 2 hours away from me.  So I'll just save my money for the Canon I've been looking at.

Reviews.Title: fotos geniales
Reviews.Author: yonathan
Reviews.Content: quede enamorado de esta camara, las fotos son geniales y nítidas, son 12 mp que capturan una escena a gran escala, soy de Venezuela y recomiendo este producto para su compra...

Reviews.Title: I HATE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: LittleOne "Suellen"
Reviews.Content: I hate this camera-- I hate this camera-- I hate this camera--I keep trying to get my pictures into my files or onto one of my photo softwares and I don't think it can be done!Did I say I hate this camera? -- Buy something you can just plug in and it will load the pictures onto your files.This isn't it!

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: jack "thorough"
Reviews.Content: There is only one word to describe this camera. Horrible. It has 15 types of settings for pictures, and a smart mode that chooses automatically. It never gets it right. The lighting is always terribly off; either too light or too dark. Would definitely not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: Kay "Fonziette"
Reviews.Content: I boought this camera for my adult daughter, she loves it.  This is her first digital camera.  She likes the size of it so she can carry it in her purse.

Reviews.Title: Kodak M341
Reviews.Author: Maydole47
Reviews.Content: If this item had a better manual, it would rate a better review.  It took me quite a while to figure out.  Granted, this is my first digital camera.  If I had known what to look for, it probably would have been easier.

Reviews.Title: product was defective
Reviews.Author: can
Reviews.Content: I was a little unlucky but I think I bought a product exchange in the ..the day I started to use the product, such as a sound processor tone began to arrive .. sound while the screen is open...I have brought to Turkey from the USA to send the product back and I could not send a warrant would be too costly to exploit ..In this way it's going to do nothing ..I hope this problem does not have one

Reviews.Title: Thumbs down
Reviews.Author: rootha
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is poor-would not recommend it.  I'd like to return it if Amazon will take it back. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Now why do I need software????
Reviews.Author: kaMundu
Reviews.Content: Everybody has a small sleek 12 mega camera now .... so that's not a selling point.  The really big hangup is that you can't download the pictures from the camera unless you load Kodak software on the computer.  That's a big BIG drag.  So many times I'm taking pictures at someone's house and I want to give them copies before I leave - then waht?  Load software on their computer just for that?? Load the software on my office computer?  On my laptop? On my desktop? All over the place??? This is such a drag.....  If I had known I would never have bought this thing!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Service
Reviews.Author: A. perez
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived on time and it arrived in brand new condition. Seller was very reliable. Thank you for your prompt service!

Reviews.Title: Boy, do I ever hate this camera!
Reviews.Author: yohmama
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this for me as a birthday gift. He thought I would like it because it is very small and fits in my purse. This is the ONLY thing I like about it. The manual is a joke, and the on-line help (only if you have internet) is only slightly better. You can't get the pictures out without laboriously loading software on your computer and then waiting 10 minutes for it to finish. You can't just plug the camera into your computer and copy the files like you could with my old camera. I don't need or want any of the "share" stuff - and it certainly is not as "easy" to use as a plain camera. It's "smart capture" feature never manages to make MY pictures look very good. Don't tell my husband, but I'm going to stuff this thing in the back of a drawer and go back to using my old one.

Reviews.Title: Wrong item
Reviews.Author: Cody W. Holt "Holttrain"
Reviews.Content: After researching other Kodak cameras I decided on this one.  It was shipped quickly but when I opened the package I found a EasyShare C190....  Called them to have my M341 shipped instead of this C190 and they are out of stock.  My first time ordering from here and they goof it up.  Now I have to send it back and wait for my refund..

Reviews.Title: A great company!!
Reviews.Author: Thomas Smith
Reviews.Content: Due to a mix up I no longer needed the camera that I purchased. Upon e-mail them the company immediately sent me a pre-paid return shipping label and credited my cc with no further problems. I am impressed with their professionalism in straightening out the problem.
